channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for KY

item.title: Report E-2024080766
item.description:
Report E-2024080766

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-04T09:14:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-23
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately 0.25 cup of material released from one (1) 375-gallon poly tote due to a loose cap. The loose cap was not damaged. The release material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel cleaned the impacted area with absorbent pads and containerized the cleanup debris into one (1) 5-gallon poly pail. The loose cap was hand tightened and then shipped on to the consignee. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâ€™s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024080695
item.description:
Report E-2024080695

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-29T09:23:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-16
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 16, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of hydrochloric acid was punctured by a skid and released approximately fifteen (15) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from TPM Group (TPM) to remediate the impacted site. Crews deployed granular absorbents to the hydrochloric acid-impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal.
